body:
> When I log at the in cloud watch multiple errors appear, one is for example:

@hollytb Could you share the full failure logs?

> `CondaValueError: prefix already exists: /miniconda/envs/custom_env`

This means that mlflow tries to create the `custom_env` conda environment multiple times. I'll investigate what causes this.
@harupy Thanks for your help, I've uploaded a csv of the logged error to the comment

@hollytb Thanks for the CSV file! I don't see `CondaValueError: prefix already exists: /miniconda/envs/custom_env`. Are you sure you got this error?

~Can you try deploying a non-spark model (e.g. scikit-learn model) and check if it succeeds?~
@hollytb https://github.com/mlflow/mlflow/issues/726 seems related. Using a larger instance might help (as suggested in https://github.com/mlflow/mlflow/issues/726#issuecomment-442187169).

@hollytb You can also try running this command to check if model serving works locally:

```bash
# Run the script you attached to log a model first, then run
mlflow sagemaker run-local -m runs:/<run_id>/model
```

@hollytb I was able to reproduce `CondaValueError: prefix already exists: /miniconda/envs/custom_env` by using `docker run --retry=always`. I think SageMaker retries running the container and the entry point (that runs `conda env create -n custom_env`) is executed multiple times.

@harupy when I check if the model is serving locally is fails with the error:
`2022/07/18 11:04:27 INFO mlflow.sagemaker: executing: docker run -v C:\Users\....\mlruns\5\0a92547...\artifacts\model:/opt/ml/model/ -p 5000:8080 -e MLFLOW_DEPLOYMENT_FLAVOR_NAME=python_function -e SERVING_ENVIRONMENT=SageMaker --rm mlflow-pyfunc serve
docker: Error response from daemon: driver failed programming external connectivity on endpoint epic_kapitsa (8d05038a9156c5aba360d24c3756d249171b95bfd0f4cd9ff8c2168d6b4d3f7a): Bind for 0.0.0.0:5000 failed: port is already allocated.` Would this be causing the deploy stage to fail?

Never mind it's attempting to run now, I had to stop the mlflow ui running in the background. Will update you with the output

@harupy  using a larger instance didn't work, would the parameters,  instance count and flavor, have a impact? 

When I check if the model is serving locally, the output doesn't come to a end, it continues to outputthe following lines:

`2022-07-18 10:40:26 +0000] [459] [INFO] Starting gunicorn 20.1.0   
[2022-07-18 10:40:26 +0000] [459] [INFO] Listening at: http://127.0.0.1:8000 (459)

@harupy So far one error has occured while running the above command:
` Exception in thread "main" java.nio.file.NoSuchFileException: /tmp/tmpg1bflz7u/connection3712313196413081753.info
        at sun.nio.fs.UnixException.translateToIOException(UnixException.java:86)

        at org.apache.spark.deploy.SparkSubmit$.main(SparkSubmit.scala:1048)
        at org.apache.spark.deploy.SparkSubmit.main(SparkSubmit.scala) `
@hollytb I ran the same command with a spark model on Linux and it worked fine. OS might be related since you're using Windows. Do you have Mac or Linux?
